adverbs.description: phenomenally (comparative more phenomenally, superlative most phenomenally)

entries.meaning: In a manner that is extraordinary or amazing.
examples: The tennis player's serve was phenomenally fast.

The 'old-look' and the 'bald-pink-and-wrinkled-look' are, in this context at least, one and the same. Phenomenally speaking, that is, the predicates 'old' and 'bald, pink, and wrinkled' here are equivalent  […]
